parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake system can cause the loss of braking power, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal goes to the floor
there is no pressure in the pedal
the brake caliper fails to release
the brake fluid catches on fire.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty thermostat can cause the engine to overheat, leading to damage to the engine, radiator, and other components, which can result in costly repairs and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: engine stalling or failure to start.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A failed catalytic converter can cause the vehicle to stall, lose power, and emit excessive pollutants, which can lead to accidents and environmental harm.
symptoms: unusual noises or smells from the exhaust system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A cracked exhaust manifold can cause the vehicle to lose power, overheat, and emit excessive pollutants, which can lead to accidents and environmental harm.
symptoms: unusual noises or smells from the exhaust system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of hand rails on buses can cause passengers to lose their balance and fall, leading to injuries or accidents, especially during sudden stops or turns.
symptoms: Hand rail breaks or detaches from the bus
passengers report difficulty holding onto the hand rail
hand rail feels loose or unstable.
